document.masterDocTitle: The Luciolinae of S. E. Asia and the Australopacific region: a revisionary checklist (Coleoptera: Lampyridae) including description of three new genera and 13 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Luciolinae of S. E. Asia and the Australopacific region: a revisionary checklist (Coleoptera: Lampyridae) including description of three new genera and 13 new species

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 70–77. Key to genera characters 11. 70–72 Serratia sibuyania gen. et sp. nov.; 73–75 Emarginata trilucida gen. nov. et comb. nov.; 76, 77 Colophotia praeusta. 70, 72, 73 dorsal habitus (70 anterior body only); 74 ventral habitus; 71 dissected terminal abdomen ventral; 75 ventrite 7 and elytral apices from below; 76, 77 ventrites 6, 7 from left (76) and below (77). Figure legends: MC median carina; MPP median posterior projection; PLP posterolateral projections.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type .
Lampyris praeusta
.
Syntype male.
PHILIPPINES
. Labelled: 1 handwritten in ink on yellow paper “ Luciola Praeusta Esch. Entomen Dj Cat D. Escholtz. Philippenfis Inf Ph. ”; 2. Handwritten in ink “ Lampyris /
praeusta Es. Manilla
”; 3. Male symbol; 4. Printed “ Coll. Chevrolat ” handwritten “ type Escholtz”. ( MNHN in Olivier collection Box 60)
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type .
Colophotia particulariventris
. Male possible holotype .
INDONESIA SULAWESI
as Celebes . Labelled 1. Handwritten in ink “ Colophotia particulariventris ? nihi; 2. Handwritten in ink “ex Wittmer”; 3. Handwritten in ink “ Celebes Sidaonta Juni 1937 ’. Standing beside this specimen in Pic Box 47 are 4 further labels which apparently relate to this specimen, and written in French. One label bears a sketch of the terminal abdominal male ventrites. ( MNHN ).

Other specimens examined .

Diagnosis . 6.6−9.5 mm long; males pale brownish yellow with black tipped elytra ( Ballantyne & Lambkin 2013 figs 99−101); distinguished from
C. plagiata
by the elytral colour (the elytra of
C. plagiata
are dark brown with pale margins), and from
C. concolor / C. brachyura
by the well-defined and acute median carina on V7 (that of
concolor / brachyura
is broader, lower and rounded). Colouration of head, antennae and labrum varies both within and between localities, as does the relative length of the PLP (see Table 14 ). LO halves in V7 narrowly and evenly separated along their inner ventral margins which are subparallel sided; with a well elevated narrow median carina with acute ventral edge which expands in depth in posterior half ( Figs 76, 77 ); strongly developed MPP which is deeply emarginated and prolonged into hooks which arise from the posterior area of the MPP and curve such that they are usually visible from beneath; MPP 2x longer than wide, not much longer than PLP (see Table 14 below for relative lengths of PLP and MPP); with strongly developed median ventral trough which is margined laterally by acute ridges. T8 lateral margins convex sided; flanges well developed, apically rounded inclining one forwards and one backwards; posterolateral corners not acutely prolonged ( Ballantyne & Lambkin 2013 figs 102, 103; 2009 figs 98−100, 104. Female with wide paired bursa plates ( Ballantyne & Lambkin 2013 figs 104−106). Aedeagal sheath: 7 x as long as wide. Aedeagu s : b/a 0.3; LL apices barely separated along their dorsal margins ( Ballantyne & Lambkin 2009 figs 101−103).
